answers.answer: I cannot answer all your questions, however I do believe that you should take what your doctor says to heart.  Also, if you are so very fearful of being diabetic perhaps you can do what a friend of mine does - which is that every time she goes in to a medical office she has her blood tested.  She is not diabetic but knows that I am.Yes, your weight could have something to do with being diabetic but I am 5 foot 9" and weight over 300 lbs.  I have lost weight but my diabetes was not discovered until I weighed much more than that.  Believe me, I was really eating "garbage" at the time and had no sort of healty diet.My last suggestion simply is that if you are truly fearful of Diabetes being in your family blood line, request a complete physical from your doctor.  You did not say what type of health coverage you have but mine is an HMO so that I have no problem getting the physical at any time.  Hopefully you can have this done so that you can rest your mind.  Or perhaps some type of counseling for the "Cyperchondriac" in you!God Bless, Anita

AnyoneCan you please tell me since I last had my blood suger tested and it was 6.3 7 points under the recomended level 5 months ago, can diabetes devolope after 5 months after I was screened for it?I am so worried, I go to the doctor about 6 times a year with my fears and yet after I see him for a few weeks I feel fine and a month afterwoods I start having symptoms of various ailments including diabetes. I am wondring can worry creat symptoms of a disease that doctors have said that you dont have?I am tied about going to doctors every 1 or 2 months that I suspect that he is sick of me comming to him. I suspect I make of about 5% of his buisness.I have lost  a tremendous amout of weigh in a year and a half. I have gone from 300 pounds to 239 pounds in that amount of time. I have also started eating healthier and have started a little more exersise and yet I am still worried and get these diabetic symptoms that keep on getting and go to doctors and they say that my blood suger is fine and belong the recomended level.PLEASE GI VE ME SOME ADVICE AND SUPPORT!

Chronic worriers often find themselves reacting to problem after problem, putting out fire after fire, so to speak. A chronic worrier may always feel on the edge of disaster. It truly is a good idea to talk to a Psychological professional. With or without professional help, you will need to learn to start acting on your problems rather than reacting to them.

question: For the past 5 years I have lived threw fear of getting Type 2 Diabetes because my fahter has it. I am what you would consider a hypochondriac who has become what you would calle a Cyberchondriac. I am 25 years old and a bit obease My height is 6 foot, 1 inch and my wight is 239 pounds. I dont have the best diet but over the last year I have been eating alot healthier. I have some symptoms that I am worried about, they are01. Dry Mouth02. Blurred visions at times03. When I look at a computer I see a light flashing04. A moderate increase in hunger05. Tingling feet06. Sweating more then usual07. HeadachesThe last time I had my blood suger checked was in January of this year, my results were 6.3 which my doctor said was below the 7.0 range which was very good and he said I dont have diabetes. I have some questions for youHow Long does Diabetes take to devolop?Can you have some symptoms of Diabetes with out Diabetes its self?Can worry produce symptoms of Diabetes?Every time I go to the doctor and have my blood suger tested it always comes back as fine, but a month or 2 after I worry about it all over again and I cant seem to stop my worries, no matter what!. I am comming to the end of my rope because of my constant worrying about things that according to my doctors I dont have and yet still have symptoms that pop up out of nowhere. I have gone to many doctors and they say I am fine.PLEASE HELP ME AND GIVE ME SOME ADVICE!
title: Fearful of Diabetes
